EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Copper Cable Factory (centered near Position(x=2.5, y=17.5))
Consists of the production interface for converting copper plates into copper cable:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter (direction DOWN) at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5)
– New factory burner inserter (direction RIGHT) at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (placed in Step 211)
– Burner inserter (direction UP) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Assembling machine “assembling-machine-1” at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

###Belt Depot (anchored at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5))
Serves as the intermediary connection for transferring items from the extraction system to the cable factory:
– Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) (crafted and placed in Step 214)
– Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) (placed in Step 215)
– Depot burner inserter (using direction UP) at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (placed in Step 216)

###Extraction System Interface (located at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5))
Provides the source of copper plates for downstream processing:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

###Electricity Generator (centered at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5))
Implements the steam‐powered energy production setup:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS

– Belt Connection Target Error  
 • When connecting transport belts, do not target a steam engine directly. Instead, add and use an inserter to input items into the steam engine.

– Placement Distance Error  
 • Ensure your position is within the allowed placement radius (max distance of 10 units) by moving closer to the intended target before placing an entity.

– Inventory Availability Error  
 • Verify that the required item (for example, a wooden chest) is present in the inventory before attempting placement.

– Variable Reference Error  
 • Check that all variables (such as the target entity’s reference) are correctly defined to prevent NameError issues.
